intro: Dianthus carpathicus, commonly known as the Carpathian pink, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is a member of the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, rounded flowers with five petals. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Dianthus carpathicus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and meadows.
